definition: to revise the current edition/revised edition

sentences.english: So which bill will come next for a makeover?
sentences.chinese: 那么，哪种面值的钞票将会成为下一个改版的呢？

sentences.english: After the redecoration, it focuses more on the "customers-centered" concept .
sentences.chinese: 经全新改版后更凸显出“以人为本”的服务理念。

sentences.english: Re-submission of the revised documents are required for confirmation.
sentences.chinese: 在进行改版后需重新递交买方确认。

sentences.english: Yahoo's home-page makeover goes beyond surface improvements.
sentences.chinese: 雅虎的主页改版不仅仅是表面的美容。

sentences.english: This time the changes were revealed in a hard-to-find blogpost.
sentences.chinese: 而这次的改版通知是在一个很难找到的博客页面上。

sentences.english: There will be some big changes upcoming in the forums.
sentences.chinese: 在即将改版上线的论坛中将会有一些巨大的变化。

sentences.english: Therefore, it has profound significance to study CCTV news channel re-editions.
sentences.chinese: 在此背景下谈央视新闻频道改版有较强的研究意义。

sentences.english: Create and modify styles for generating image modifications such as thumbnails.
sentences.chinese: 创建和编辑生成图片的修改版的样式，例如缩略图。

sentences.english: In what way do you wish to see Xinwen Lianbo reform?
sentences.chinese: 你希望《新闻联播》怎么改版？

sentences.english: The modified Symbol of the Light seems to mark sanctuaries and holy places.
sentences.chinese: 在许多庇护所和圣堂都可以看到这种加亮的改版标识。

sentences.english: We have also heard that MSNBC will soon launch a redesign of its own.
sentences.chinese: 听说MSNBC很快也将进行网站改版。

definition: to make a copy/to reproduce/to remake (a movie)
to replace the old with new/to renew/to renovate/to upgrade/to update/to regenerate
player (of a game)/enthusiast (audio, model planes etc)
to transition to a new dynasty or regime/to replace an older product with an upgraded, new-generation one
to put goods on shelves/(of a product) to be available for sale
to escalate (in intensity)/to go up by one grade/to be promoted/to upgrade (computing)
